title: 115_s1913
content: The "American Prairie Conservation Act" may be cited as the short title. Crop production on native sod is addressed in the Act. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include provisions for native sod acreage tilled for crop production, subject to a reduction in benefits under the American Prairie Conservation Act. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include provisions for native sod acreage tilled for crop production, subject to a reduction in benefits under the American Prairie Conservation Act for non-hay and non-forage crops. The Federal Crop Insurance Act is amended to include provisions for native sod acreage tilled for crop production, subject to a reduction in benefits under the American Prairie Conservation Act for non-hay and non-forage crops. Producers must certify native sod conversion to receive benefits under this subtitle. Producers must certify tilled native sod acreage for crop production using an acreage report form and maps. They must promptly submit corrections for any changes discovered after certification. The Secretary must submit annual reports on certified tilled native sod acreage to the Committees on Agriculture. Amendments are made to the Noninsured Crop Disaster Assistance section of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996. The Secretary will report on certified tilled native sod acreage annually to the Agriculture Committees. Amendments are made to the Noninsured Crop Disaster Assistance section of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996, including reductions in benefits for native sod acreage tilled for covered crop production. During the first 4 crop years after planting, native sod acreage tilled for covered crops other than hay or forage will have benefits reduced for 4 cumulative years under the American Prairie Conservation Act. During each crop year, native sod acreage tilled for hay or forage crops after the American Prairie Conservation Act's enactment will face a 4-year reduction in benefits. During each crop year, native sod acreage tilled for hay or forage crops after the American Prairie Conservation Act's enactment will face a 4-year reduction in benefits. Producers must certify to the Secretary using an acreage report form from the Farm Service Agency to receive benefits under this section. Beginning on the date a producer submits a certification to the Secretary, they must promptly report any changes in tilled native sod acreage. Annual reports are required by January 1st of each year from 2019 to 2023. The Secretary must submit an annual report to the Committees on Agriculture regarding certified tilled native sod acreage by January 1, 2023. Amendments to the Agricultural Act of 2014 extend the reporting requirement to 2023.
